Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel We spent three nights at Hotel Boheme in November at the start of our honeymoon. I travel a lot with work and so we wanted something different. The four poster bed was great and although the room was small (even by UK standards), it was clean and full of character. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There were lots of local restaurants, cafes and attractions, including City Lights book store which is a couple of blocks away. If you like the cafe culture of the mediterranean, then I'd recommend this hotel as the atmosphere of the area is very similar.
Reviews.Author: Aloj

Reviews.Content: excellent We stayed here for four nights, when we drew up outside it was just a door way in a busy street but when you get in side its lovely. A lady called kate checked us in and gave all the information we needed, she even one night phoned through a takeaway pizza order for us as our mobile didnt work! Our room was very comfortable with two double beds, tv and shower room. Only little thing it would have been nice to have coffee making facilities in the room. We were located in italian quarter so lots of great italian restaurants. Not far from china town either which is worth a wonder. We found a fantastic cafe for breakfast called pats cafe it has a bright yellow front. and is located in taylor street. Found it on our first morning we were jet lagged and starving, food and service were excellent and the coffee kept comming! Kept us going till the evening! Not far to pier 39 but we recommend going in the morning its quiet but a little tacky and go and see Alcatraz its brilliant book tickets before you go we went 9am boat and its quieter. All in all we loved the hotel we would definately recommed it to friends.
Reviews.Author: jers3ygirl

Reviews.Content: Fifty Fifty at the Hotel Boh猫me Stayed at the Hotel Boheme for the last two night in the San Francisco, Napa Valley, Carmel vacation. We had three people in our party the first night we had a fine room with two queen beds. We knew we had to change rooms the second night to a queen bed and a futon. Well the futon turned out to be a small dirty cushon on the floor. The room window was next to the exhaustvent of the restaurant on the first floor it sounded like a jet engine. We got no sleep that night. The hotel is on the second floor with only a very narrow stairway.The Hotel is in a great location in Little Italy. Just make sure you do not stay in Room 207. or if they request a futon run to a different hotel.
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsBay

Reviews.Content: Living SMALL and WELL in North Beach We arrived at Hotel Boh猫me from SFO via Lorries airport shuttle as per recommendation from the Boh猫me staff. Originally built in the 1880s by an Italian immigrant family鈥ypical three-story structure with lodging on the upper floors and retail stores on the ground floor. As it currently stands, Boh猫me's specially designed to reflect the culture and taste of late fifties North Beach with strong, inviting colors and patterns and eclectic memorabilia from the Beat days (Ferlinghetti, Ginsburg) . Not for everyone鈥檚 tastes, but we happily hauled our bags up the curved flight of striped-carpeted stairs. Stan, who was working the front desk throughout the weekend, checked on Room 103 and said it was ready for us, no need to wait until 2 p.m. check-in time. He also was glad to orient us to the possibilities of the neighborhood and sights throughout the city and helped us devise a strategy so that we were first in line for breakfast at Mama's the next morning. A most congenial start to SF!We were booked for two nights (at $397 total) in a room with a queen-sized cast-iron bed, a bistro table, two toile-covered wicker chairs...and designated as Cozy. We鈥檇 have preferred 鈥淐omfortable鈥?for $10 a day more but none were available when I made our reservations in early August. Loved the boho-chic style, but the space was small enough to feel confining and the antique armoire was a challenge. 鈥淟et鈥檚 make it work,鈥?I thought to myself and suggested that we unpack only the clothing we planned to wear during our 48 hours in SF.Columbus Ave. is lined with restaurants and caf猫s...many with sidewalk seating beneath heat lamp like Calzone鈥檚, inches left of Boh猫me's front door, where we ate on Saturday and small trattorias like L鈥橭steria del Forno, where we ate on Sunday.Living well in North Beach鈥xcept that we were so worn out from all the fresh air and activity that both evenings it wasn鈥檛 much later than 9:30 p.m. when we crawled into bed. A 9:30 bedtime in North Beach may sound like an oxymoron, but remember for us, it was past midnight (and we'd sipped some complimentary sherry in the lobby). Despite the increasing street noise -- traffic, voices and the beat of bongos -- we drifted off to sleep.
Reviews.Author: Pat_Picks

Reviews.Content: Great Location Rooms are OK......no views......baths are Good....kinda funky place....BUT....Great location in the midst of North Beach area right around the corner from ChinaTown.Caffe Greco across the street has great coffee and cappucino....great place to sit outside and people watch!Good restaraunts in the area....we ate at the Albano down the hill toward Fisherman's Wharf......very good food....very small family owned place.
Reviews.Author: UpNy08

Reviews.Content: A lovely stay in a Great Location! Hotel Appearance is a doorway off the street. Don't expect to see a hotel/BB frontage. You wouldn't realise it was a hotel at all - as it is also surrounded in restaurants.Check In was standard, nothing exceptional. However, we were shocked to realise we had to walk a narrow, winding staircase to the Reception, and further staircase to our room. Whilst the gentleman at the desk kindly assisted with our cases, we still needed to 'lug' our bags up all these suitcases. Rooms are quite small, like an English BB - whereby you have a room in a house, rather than a room in a Hotel. However, rooms where very clean.Hotel is centrally located to everything. Restaurants at your doorstep. Fishermans Wharf only 15 minute walk. The highlights for our stay were : Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz, walking the Golden Gate, the italian restaurant next door to hotel was excellent (alfresco dining), the trams. Great shopping down at Fishermans Wharf too.Overall, Hotel Boheme was located in an old area, the hotel has been refurbished. We weren't disappointed with our stay and staff were very pleasant and obliging.
Reviews.Author: TraceyMcM

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel       Enjoyng the Sherry
Reviews.Author: Scoops32

Reviews.Content: reviews were right. we loved this hotel! after much research in tripadvisor and other travel sites, we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this summer. the location is perfect with several great italian restaurants, bakery and coffee shops nearby. the room was clean and the decor really cozy. i cannot say enough about the hotel staff and front desk who were very helpful in ensuring our needs were met. i would stay there again on my next trip to san francisco.
Reviews.Author: docneneng

Reviews.Content: Fantastic!       double room
Reviews.Author: pixiern

Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel We stayed for 6 nights at The Hotel Boheme and thought it was fantastic. As we had done our homework and read other reviews we understood that this was a small boutique hotel with no lift and were expecting the rooms to be small maybe noisy if we were on the front.However, I am not sure if staying in room 208 has a distinct advantage over the rooms but it was perfect. We didn't think the room was too small at all, especially compared to hotels in the Centre of London. We had plenty of natural light on the back and it was quiet. It didn't bother us in the slightest that we had to carry our bags up some stairs.The staff were extremely polite and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The location is absolutely a plus point, it is safe with plently of restaurants and bars. Washington Square is round the corner, the Beat history on your doorstep and a 20 minute stroll takes you right down to fisherman's wharf and the piers.The only thing that slightly frustrated us was the noise of the showers when guests woke up early, they were very loud in our room but we used our ear plugs we had bought just in case and we were able to sleep really well.I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and stay there again without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: Tirre

Reviews.Content: Consistent with what you read... Pretty much on par with what you will read on this site. The staff is very nice and helpful. Rooms are small/cozy and as with many places in San Francisco there is no AC. We have found the nights to be cool enough when leaving windows open. The night cap of sherry is a very comfortable touch. Location was great for what we wanted to do. We were able to walk to Pier 33 area to the south, Fisherman's Wharf to the north, and a great restaurant called Frascati's to the west. North Beach is primarily Italian restaurants. Also very close to Chinatown if you want to see that.All and all it was what we expected and served our needs quite well.
Reviews.Author: jmichfev

Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay here My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights at the hotel. Although it is not a plush modern hotel, we certainly thought it was a charming little place.Yes, there are some stairs and no elevators, but so what.. it is only one floor to climb. We carried our own luggage. Didn't even think twice about it.We got there hours earlier than our check-in time and thought that we'll just drop off our bags and come back. Since the people who stayed at our room had just left the nice man at the counter took our cell number, prioritized the cleaning of our room, and got us in promptly.The room was nice. It was small but that is typical of most rooms in a major city, especially SF. The decor was very nice. The bathroom doesn't have a tub but everything was clean. The tv is small but we didn't go there to watch tv shows.Our room faced the street on the second floor. The neighborhood is great! My favorite in SF. I had a good time just sitting at the window and people watching. The one negative thing is that we slept with the windows open and it was a bit loud.I thought that the negative reviews were a bit unfair. I don't think anyone should expect this place to have all the amenities of a modern 5 star hotel. If you do, check into a Hilton. This is a hotel of older elegance and it does feel special in many ways. It is also very reasonably priced (considering location). I'd recommend this place and will consider staying here again.
Reviews.Author: dream_e

Reviews.Content: major overpriced disappointment I agree with weekapaug...I don't understand the rave reviews for this place. I looked over the hotel's website before booking, and nowhere was it mentioned that there is no air conditioning and there are no elevators. Seems like something people might want to know before booking a $200/night room, especially if they have health or mobility issues. There is also no parking or valet, not even temporary parking while you run in to get directions to the nearest parking garage. My husband had to circle the block repeatedly while I got the garage directions, not an easy feat in this neighborhood.After lugging our suitcases up two long flights of stairs, we were hot and sweaty and had only our creaky open window and a small fan for relief. We marveled at the tiny TV, in a size we didn't even think was still manufactured. Then we flushed the toilet, and the flush handle fell off. Yes, fell off. In a $200/night room with no AC. Fortunately the lady at the desk was able to fix it, but I told her I expected a discount, as the hotel was full and we could not be given a different room.The free sherry in the reception area was no longer a perk after this, but a necessity.Unless you're the kind of person who enjoys backpacking through Europe, avoid this hotel.
Reviews.Author: LexiSterling

Reviews.Content: Great Location We just spent 3 nights at the Boheme - the staff are really friendly and helpful the rooms although on the small side are clean the bathroom was excellent. i would definItely stay here again. Great location for anywhere in SF
Reviews.Author: pje39

Reviews.Content: Would not stay again I really don't understand how this hotel is ranked so high on TripAdvisor. My wife and I (we're in our late 20's) just stayed here at the end of July for 3 nights and were somewhat disappointed. Like other reviews mention, there is no elevator and TON of steps. If you're carrying up luggage, good luck! Check-in was fine, no issues.I know the rooms were described as being small by other reviewers and even the hotel when booking but jeeez man. They were TINY. With both of our suitcases on the floor we literally had no room to walk. Our room was at the back of the hotel with a terrible view. The hotel has no AC and even though it was not that hot, the room always felt stuffy and warm. The bathroom was also very small and found it difficult to move around in (I'm 6'0, 175lbs).The location is the best part of the hotel. Within walking distance to most tourist attractions in the city and there are bus stops located very close to the hotel as well. The restaurant located to the left of the hotel when exiting was terrible. I think it was called Calzones. The following night we had dinner at The House which was only 1 block from the hotel. It was by far one of the best meals I've had ever. Stan, the evening shift front desk person was also very helpful with directions and suggestions for sightseeing and meals. I would not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: weekapaug

Reviews.Content: A great deco.. what else? I was disapointed by Hotel Boheme, and for once i don鈥檛 share the general opinion of the T.A. reviews . OK, the deco is great , there is a special atmosphere , and the location is good , even if i prefer Union Square .... but , what else ? There is no elevator, be prepared if you have heavy suitcases ; our room was small, there was no bathtub , only a shower, no coffeemaker , the TV was a bit larger than a box of matches (bring binoculars if you actually intend to watch it ) , and the room was directly on Colombus avenue , an important street of San Francisco with a lot of traffic night and day , and peole speaking loudly or screaming .. night and day too ! The staff is professional , i wouldn鈥檛 say friendly . The breakfast is not included and even not possible ; ok, there is a big choice of cafes around , but it makes an aditional cost on the bill.I don鈥檛 say it is a bad hotel , but when you evaluate something you have to consider what you get and what you pay : i am sorry , but it is overpriced and for more than 200$ / night without complimentary breakfast there are better deals in San Francisco ; see for example my other review here. If i return to San francisco it will certainly not stay in this hotel.
Reviews.Author: LOUGIR

Reviews.Content: loved the boheme       room at boheme
Reviews.Author: beach10

Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel! The reviews are true! This hotel was a great find in San Francisco. For the price I'd have to say that I don't know how you'd beat it. We arrived early and the front desk was accomodating saying they would call immediately when the room was available and giving us a brief overview of the area. I'm confident in saying that if I had any questions about the city the hotel staff would have been more than happy to answer them. They did give us a great recommendation for a local Italian restaurant and seemed to truly enjoy talking about the neighborhood! Location, location, location. We loved being in North Beach. It was near many major tourist attractions but had such a different vibe than the Union Square area. It was truly a cool neighborhood with restaurants  cafes; a great place to come home to after exploring the city.The room was smallish but spotless and we thought the bed was comfortable. It was very uniquely decorated. Everything worked fine. Complimentary sherry in the evenings was a nice touch.Overall this is an excellent choice for many travelers. However, if you need a big hotel with many amenities then this may not be the place for you. I will definitely be back and make this my San Francisco hotel in the future. Very highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17

Reviews.Content: Great Boheme       Alcatraz worth a visit
Reviews.Author: JackMan_ValleyGirl

Reviews.Content: Don't even think of choosing any other hotel in SF!       Cozy room
Reviews.Author: TC_Jr

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at Hotel Boheme. The cost is very reasonable. The room was small but fine for two people. We were rarely in the room as there is so much to do in the area that I don't see why you would want to pay for a large suite anywhere else. Our room faced the street but the noise did not bother us at all. I loved the location with all the nice cafes and restaurants in North Beach plus it is in the middle between union square and the wharf. We were not interested in shopping which is why this hotel made more sense for us versus those in union square which is the furthest area from many of the tourist sites.
Reviews.Author: rlsderbycity

Reviews.Content: Brilliant! Hotel Boheme is beautiful. The service was fantastic with helpful suggestions for places to eat and shows to attend, and assistance with travel arrangements. Quite simply the best service I've ever encountered in any hotel in any country I've visited.The rooms are not large, but more than make up for it with location and atmosphere (and are as large or larger than rooms in many European hotels).The rooms are stylish, cosy and spotlessly clean, a great contrast to the usual generic hotel look. Beds are super comfortable and my room (at the back) was very quiet. I felt immediately at home and will definitely be returning.The position of the hotel in North Beach means you're close to everything and in an area that feels safe at night.All up - fantastic!
Reviews.Author: RH155

Reviews.Content: Cool hotel, well located Hotel Boheme has a great location slap bang in the middle of the Italian area of North Beach and close to Chinatown. You can also walk to Fisherman's Wharf in one direction and the Financial District in the other. The North Beach area is really interesting and lively, once home to the Beats and the famous City Lights bookstore, there is always something going on. There's also a plethora of restaurants in the area - I would recommend L'Osteria del Forno for Italian and House of Nanking for Chinese.The hotel is well decorated and does have something of a Bohemian feel to it, certainly beats staying in a faceless corporate chain. The staff are very friendly and helpful. As it is on a busy street, we opted to stay in a back room, which leads to my only real issue with the place - the windows in our room opened out onto a tiny gap and then more walls, so there was minimal natural light coming in. We were glad of the peace and quiet but the room was pretty dark.Overall though, really enjoyed San Francisco and thought this was an excellent base to explore the city from.
Reviews.Author: Siharris28

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location I recently stayed in the Hotel Boheme's only quad room with a friend and our 13-year-old daughters. Overall our experience was terrific, and I would certainly enthusiastically recommend the Hotel Boheme, particularly to smaller groups of travelers, who would have a broader selection of rooms to choose from.Perhaps the biggest advantage of the Boheme is the location. We are so glad we stayed in North Beach!! The cafes and restaurants were wonderful, and we loved the proximity to Telegraph Hill, City Lights Bookstore, and more. North Beach is walking distance to just about everywhere and was, in our opinion, the perfect neighborhood to come home to at the end of a long day.Second advantage was the terrific staff, all of whom were friendly, helpful, and welcoming.Third, the great decor. Fourth, the sherry, which is set out for guests every evening! Fifth, the character of the place. It is original and distinctive, which in this age of tedious standardization is a real plus.For our group, there were 2 disadvantages:First, the large room we stayed in is located at the back of the hotel, and there was very little natural light. I would have traded the quiet of our rear room for some light in one of the front rooms, and if I ever have the pleasure of staying at the Boheme again, I will definitely request a room at the front of the hotel.Second, the Boheme lacks any sort of public spaces except for a small landing near the reception desk. Again, the benefits of the great location outweighed this disadvantage, but it is something travelers should be aware of.Overall, a great, original hotel in a great neighborhood!
Reviews.Author: EminMaine

Reviews.Content: Perfect little hideaway in great neighborhood. Staff knows area well and happy to refer guests to whatever their interest might be. Excellent location for using public transportation. Hotel can arrange shuttle to airport at substantial cost savings. Hotel is very European - old European - which means smaller rooms, limited amenities, some street noise possible, stairs are unavoidable . No coffee, desks in room and probably not ideal for business person that needs a working space in the hotel. As long as guests are honest with themselves about expectations, they should love the hotel, a rich and still living history and anything but the sometimes sterile predictability of modern hotels.
Reviews.Author: flysalot

Reviews.Content: Charming, clean, and great staff My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Boheme in the middle of January. Upon arrival we were a little skeptical as the doorway is slightly hidden between an Italian restaurant and coffee bar/bakery. As soon as we walked in we received a very warm welcome, a map of the area, and an invitation to a glass of nightly Sherry. Sitting in the entry way is a book of historical newspaper clippings and articles about some of the famous people from the Beat generation and the surrounding San Francisco area. When we walked into our room we were slightly taken back by the size (small) of the room. The bed had one of those mesquito netting things hanging over top of it, which we continue to joke about now. After our initial shock we began to love our cute little hotel centered in the middle of a great Italian neighborhood and in walking distance of nearly every attraction. You really couldn't ask for a better location.The staff was superb, you will know them by first name after a day of staying. You are provided a key to the front door so each night you return it is almost as if you were staying with a family member or friend. We fell in love with this hotel and are very pleased we stayed at The Boheme. Only one word of caution...it is a very quite hotel, this may be a blessing or in some few cases, a curse.
Reviews.Author: mandi_8

Reviews.Content: La Boheme - just okay Not sure what I was expecting, but I suppose just a little bit more... we're relatively local  were looking for a romantic overnight (dinner, show  sleeping in without a two-year-old kid!). The entrance is promising, subtle  just quirky enough for my tastes. No one helped us with our bags (just buzzed us in), but no big deal, my husband handled that. The gentleman at the reception desk was kind enough to let us in our room a few minutes early. Once we got there, I was pretty surprised at how small it was. I paid for a comfortable (vs. cozy) room, so hopefully this is what I got... but it was certainly very small! The decor was okay, although my husband wondered aloud if we should be expecting a swarm of mosquitos.... (romantic mosquito netting around the bed). The bedding was pretty shabby  the pillows were flat, and at the same time, lumpy. I got the impression that everything was very very nice, maybe about 5 (more?) years ago. Definitely needs an update. I wasn't there to watch TV, but in case you are, it is a small (15 inches?) set. We also had an interior room - no view. This didn't really bother me, as I preferred it to the noisy Columbus Ave. side. The bathroom was actually great, with nice hair products  good water pressure in the shower. The location is also great, within walking distance of every place you want to go in North Beach. We ate at several of the local restaurants (yes, all in one day!) and had breakfast at the yummy (and conveniently located downstairs) Stella Pastry. All in all, it was okay  I guess I didn't pay that much to stay here. I would probably take my chances elsewhere next time though.
Reviews.Author: pixiecat

Reviews.Content: charming!       our room
Reviews.Author: mariavoici

Reviews.Content: Great place, but ask for a room with views       bedroom
Reviews.Author: scduthie

Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hotel, outstanding location Even with numerous positive reviews I couldn't help but add one more. This hotel is tremendous. Between it's ideal location for seeing San Francisco on foot and its absolutely fantastic staff we had the best vacation ever. The staff is friendly and amazingly helpful. Every suggestion was spot on. We walked easily everywhere from Union Square to the Wharf. The only negative to this hotel is the steep stairs. We were on the second level and my husband grumbled a bit because we'd just walked all over the city. I highly recommend Cafe Roma down the street for your coffee fix and Mo's for a good burger. We loved both.
Reviews.Author: KathyL69

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Area My husband and I stayed at Hotel Boheme from 10/27-11/01. I loved the charm of our hotel and room. My husband felt the room was much too small. It was small but I didn't mind, as we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel or in our room. North Beach is a very hip, busy area and I think in the perfect spot. We were within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 Easy access to public transportation and great restaurants and things to do steps outside our door. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: rikang

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel Stayed at the Boheme as part of our San Francisco leg of our wine country 5 day tripHotel is in a GREAT location. Very small quaint place. The front desk people are MORE than helpful. The rooms are very small and our room did not have a view, but it was quiet and the rooms were quiet. This is the type of place you want to stay that is not chain hotel and that you can come home and lay your clothes. Its not the type of hotel that you go to in order to enjoy the amenities of the actual hotel. All in all, it was a nice stay and I would stay there again. Walking distance from almost all the landmark places, right on the edge of China town, right in the middle of Little Italy. Tram and bus stops right around the corner and outside the door.
Reviews.Author: Treva

Reviews.Content: fabulous Boheme! We had the pleasure of staying at the Boheme for 4 nights, and have only positive things to say. The position of the hotel could not be better and was convenient for all of the tourist attractions. The room at the Boheme was at the front of the hotel, and being on the main road did not bother us, in fact it was nice to watch the street below whilst enjoying a glass of wine!. I could not praise the staff highly enough, who were always happy to assist and very friendly, and yes, the stairs are steep but we knew this from reading other trip advisors report, and therefore we expected this!.North Beach is a fantastic area, with lots to do, with a good selection of coffee shops and restaurants.We hope to go back to SF in the near future and will be definitely staying at the Boheme.
Reviews.Author: supergeordie

Reviews.Content: Cute hotel but staff weren't very helpful. This is a pretty little hotel in a great area but I was disappointed with the staff. I had to carry my large and heavy suitcase up 2 narrow flights of stairs without any help or offer of help. In fact, the person on the front desk just watched me struggle with it! Personally I think this hotel is overrated. I wouldn't return here.
Reviews.Author: Charlotte23inOz

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location/Great Value My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Boheme from 9/21-9/25 for our anniversary. I had never been to San Francisco but knew that I needed a hotel within walking distance of all of the areas that we planned to visit. Hotel Boheme ended up being the perfect choice! It is located in Little Italy between downtown and Fisherman's Whorf, close to Knob Hill, Russian Hill, Telegraph Hill and Chinatown.The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful. Not only were they all very nice, but they were eager to help make sure that you had everything you need. I am used to a larger scale hotel, so this was my first stay in a boutique hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small, but ample for two people and nicely decorated. I have no complaints or suggestions that could have made our stay any better than it was and highly recommend this property.
Reviews.Author: meow1227

Reviews.Content: Quiet place in downtown SF Stayed 3 nights in September. This is a small oasis in the heart of the very lively, yet pleasant 'North Beach' district. The latter was rated as one of the best districts in urban US to stay.No noise from outside was heard in our (backside) room though. The central location and the kindness of the hotel staff more than compensates for the relatively small rooms and limited room facilities. Absolutely a great place to stay when visiting central SF.
Reviews.Author: Vuppy

Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Boheme It's all been said before about Hotel Boheme but we enjoyed this place so much that it didn't seem right to neglect to post a positive review.Great location if you like being in the centre of things, bags of personality, helpul staff.If we're ever lucky enough to get to San Francisco again, we'd be back there.
Reviews.Author: KarenIS

Reviews.Content: fun location! Hotel Boheme is located RIGHT on Columbus Avenue, and we arrived on a Saturday night--picture tons of people going/coming from bars, bachelorette parties, and lots of noise. We had been traveling around California and staying in quiet, peaceful BBs. But the good thing was that it gave us the opportunity to see a new area in San Francisco. The hotel itself is cute and interesting--with netted canopies over the beds, and paper umbrellas hanging as lampshades. The literary/beat history of the hotel is interesting if you're into that sort of thing. The location was great--we could walk to Fisherman's Wharf and were surrounded by amazing family-style Italian restaurants.
Reviews.Author: travelsofsprout

Reviews.Content: Moulin Rouge meets Indochine The Hotel Boheme is hidden off the main street of Columbus Avenue and stepping through the door and red velvet curtains takes you to another world - a blend of Moulin Rouge and Indochine. The hotel is beautifully furnished with decadent colours, dark wood, art deco tiles and oriental designs. The staff are very helpful - full of great advice and tops tips for visitors to North Beach (the area). This is definitely the best part of the city to stay in - plenty of restaurants, boutiques, nightlife and Washingtion Square park to relax in. It's also really easy to walk to the adjoining neighbourhoods of China Town, the financial district, Fisherman's Whaft and Russian Hill (although be aware of San Francisco's hills!). Ask for a room at the back, away from Columbus Avenue, as it was really quiet. The only drawback was no bath or breakfast but ask for the whereabouts of Curly's a couple of streets away. Fabulous breakfasts!
Reviews.Author: LondonZoe

Reviews.Content: Unique, central, wonderful If you are a boring type of be-speckled seeker of mediocrity and universal hotel decore, this is not the hotel for you.If you appreciate character, ambiance, originality and 1930's Paris then you will probably like this hotel. As you will probably gather from the other reviews, this place will appeal to some people and not others. We certainly fell in love with the place: the old-school service, the evening port, the bakeries and fresh coffee at the front door, the closeness to Little Italy and China Town, but more than anything the black and white art deco tiles in the small bathroom.Sure the rooms aren't that big, but an expresso is not big either, and I'd prefer a shot of expresso to one of those 24 ounce mugs of sludge they serve as coffee in the States any day. Bigger is not better, so give me quality over quantity and I'm happy.
Reviews.Author: SimonandMarg

Reviews.Content: Great Location       View down to financial centre, from outside the hotel
Reviews.Author: mattylad

Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, excellent location, delicious restaurants. My hotel goal was to be able to walk out the front door, stroll down the street, and find a great cafe. Hotel Boheme, in North Beach, fit that goal perfectly. My husband and I checked in around 9 pm, enjoyed a complimentary glass of sherry provided by the wonderful concierge, and headed out to find a late dinner. We had our pick of places right outside the hotel. I highly recommend Figaros, just two doors down (best filet mignon!). Breakfast was equally tasty at the coffee shop next door. The hotel is charming, with rich color schemes and furniture. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable, with great water pressure. We were advised to book a room in back, rather than on the street, and it was quiet. Fresh roses in the hall capped it off nicely. Did I mention the sherry?This was my first trip to San Francisco. We spent a couple nights in a hotel up on Nob Hill, which had a lovely view but lacked the intimacy and charm of Boheme. The North Beach area was defiinitely my favorite part of town - so much flavor! - and very close to China Town and the Telegraph Hill historical district. I recommend the hike up to Coit Tower, just a few blocks behind Boheme, for spectacular views of the Bay Bridge and downtown. We walked around until 2 am.I recommend Hotel Boheme for anyone looking for a unique hotel in the heart of the city (especially if you like italian food!).
Reviews.Author: AlaskaMinta

Reviews.Content: Totally Perfect!       Shower
Reviews.Author: EFB

Reviews.Content: Loved Boheme! Great boutique hotel in a fun part of town. Right in the midst of italian cafes with great gelato, canoli, late night lasagna, etc., and Chinatown/Northbeach only minutes away. Easy, short walk to tourist areas including Fisherman's Wharf and the Ferry Building. We stayed here for our honeymoon, and we loved seeing a more unique side of San Fran! The man at the front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating (even carried my husband's 80 pound suitcase up the front stairs for us while he parked the car!) I probably shouldn't admit this...but I took off my engagement and wedding rings to clean up one morning and forgot them...rushed back 20 mins later and although the cleaning staff had already been through, they were still there!Only minor drawbacks to note:Was a little hot when we entered the room early evening, but cooled down by 8pm both nights. There was some road noise on the 2nd floor if we left our windows open, maybe better to request a higher floor if this is an issue. Someone did try to pickpocket me only a few blocks away, although we were never concerned about safety in the area.
Reviews.Author: lbeau

Reviews.Content: great It was great. Very different. all old fashioned.district great. coffee shop next door brill. sherry lovely each night, i dont even like sherry but it was so gracious,i had room on the main road which was very noisy but nice to look out the window. i was on my own so it worked out very expensive (approx 拢100 a night) you could get a lot more for a lot less at fishermans wharf but it was so nice and different it was worth it. i am still paying off credit card payments but i will treasure memories for ever. try it
Reviews.Author: crosspatch

Reviews.Content: A Nice Break from Cookie Cutter Hotels!!! This little property is great! The neighbourhood is so vibrant and full of life!!! All I can do is confirm what you will read in so many other reviews. One thing that really stood out for us was the ability to walk just about everywhere from the Hotel - Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. I was very impressed. Stan was a great asset in terms of telling us where to go and also where to stay away from.We had an inner room which was a little dark but all in all nice and quiet and very clean. For the money and the location I'd say that you are getting pretty good value for the money.***If you are wanting to do the Alcatraz Tour which is absolutely fascinating and a must-do by almost everyone's account that visits San Fran, then make sure you book ahead of time!Have fun and enjoy!
Reviews.Author: #1Vancouverite

Reviews.Content: Great Stay at Hotel Boheme We stayed at Hotel Boheme 06/09 to 06/13. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are a little small but they are different from the norm and cozy. Bathroom was large enough with shower and the room was immaculate. Every one at the desk was always very helpful. Stan was especially helpful holding our luggage and giving us directions. If you don't want to venture from the norm don't stay here. There are no elevators and you have to carry your luggage upstairs. There is no restaurant, so no room service. It can get loud especially Saturday night, but I was so tired that I didn't care or bring ear plugs. Pros: Loved the neighborhood. Calzones on one side, Stella's on the other side. Across the street Cafe Greco and Cafe Puccini. City Lights is just down the street. It's a very lively part of town. Lots of places to eat, bars, cafes and shopping. Felt very safe. Would'nt stay any where else.
Reviews.Author: dapmag3

Reviews.Content: Great location, not generic A love it or hate it hotel. We really loved it. The room was kind of small but the decor was unique and charming, not generic like most hotel rooms. The bathrooms were beautiful, there was a large wicker stand perfect for storing toiletries and cottonballs and q-tips provided in bathroom. The location was great, surrounded by Italian restaurants, pastry shops, and coffee. Not really much nightlife within walking distance though, but can always find cab. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The parking is like $24 a night but is close to hotel and next to police station, and you don't really need a car anyway. If you do have a car, you have to park it in the street while unloading luggage and be prepared to walk one flight of stairs to get to front desk. You have to push the buzzer to get into the hotel, but they give you a key to the front door after you check in. I would stay there again, but bring less luggage.
Reviews.Author: kelllebelllle

Reviews.Content: The perfect city break This was the first stop on our honeymoon and we were absolutely delighted with it. It's a little boutique hotel in a splendid location in the centre of the city within walking distance of Fishermans' Wharf on one side and the financial district and Union Square on the other. On the doorstep are some fantastic cafes which are perfect for breakfast and the centre of the thriving chinatown which connects the italian quarter with the main shopping areas.The hotel itself is lovely. The staff are very friendly and the rooms and very clean and beautifully decorated. The whole feel is very laid back but every need is taken care of. This is the perfect stopping place to explore the city. It doesn't claim to have all the modern conveniences of bigger hotels - but with its location, friendly staff, and masses of character, it doesn't need to.
Reviews.Author: Silyoj

Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a first visit to San Francisco       Hotel Boheme
Reviews.Author: ThatNameIsTaken

Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We had a lovely 3 night stay at this hotel. The whole feel to the place was really homely and all the staff were incredibly helpful giving ideas for restaurants and directions. We stayed at the front which was a little noisy (but it was Saturday night) and it didn't keep us awake. The area was great - close to a lot of the sights but also with loads of cafes and restaurants on the doorstep. I would definitely stay here agin.
Reviews.Author: KittyC93

Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in San Francisco       View from Sausalito
Reviews.Author: pugpeople

Reviews.Content: Really liked the Boheme I recently stayed at the Hotel Boheme for a total of five nights. I booked through their website and spent 169usd pls tax per night. The hotel is in a great location, very close to Chinatown and some great restaurants. Staff at the hotel was exceptionally friendly and very helpful. Rooms are small, but charming and very clean. City Lights Bookstore is across the street, it is only a short walk to Washington Square Park an Coit Tower. There are some great breakfast places (Mamas, La Boulange, Cafe Trieste) nearby.I really enjoyed the stay and would definately come back.
Reviews.Author: Nina72

Reviews.Content: a bit pricey I was really excited to stay at this hotel based on what the other reviewers had to say about it (romantic, charming, etc.). However, I was a little disappointed when I got there. The rooms are cute, but small and there is not much ambiance to the hotel as it is tiny. The sherry happy hour every evening is nice, but there is really nowhere to hang out and sit. I must say the location is GREAT and it is easy to get to almost anywhere in the city. Location alone though I would not recommend spending the $200 (after tax) a night. For that much I am looking for a little bit more than just location. Overall a nice experience, but I doubt I will return to stay there.
Reviews.Author: lkdb

Reviews.Content: great find We decided to stay in North Beach for our quick weekend trip to San Francisco. The hotel reminds me of the many apartments I lived in for the 10 years I lived in SF...the rooms are small, but cozy. The bathrooms are small but very well lit and shower was good....This is not the Four Seasons, but it is a great neighborhood hotel. It feels a bit like a bed and breakfast. The management was extremely helpful - printed boarding passes, gave a great breakfast recommendation (Mama's), and was always cheerful. For a short trip it was perfect. We parked around the corner in a garage.It is a lively and interesting neighborhood for eating, walking and getting a feel for San Francisco.
Reviews.Author: babyknewport

Reviews.Content: Only good things to report       A nice little room
Reviews.Author: Mare123Portland

Reviews.Content: north beach gem You'll feel like a local in this unbeatable location in the city within walking distance of the best restaurants, bars and cafes. Don't drive a car unless you really need one - parking is around the corner 1 block away for $26/day. Cabs and buses are everywhere and it's centrally located to anything in S.F. Hotel is super clean, stylish, romantic boutique style. No bathtub, but bathroom was clean and cute. Sherry is served in the afternoon. Some rooms face Columbus St. with minor street noice. Others are in back of hotel and quiet. Stayed in Room 107 with partial view of Coit Tower. If you want to spend $250+ go to the Fairmont, otherwise nothing can compare with this price rance. Do not miss Trattoria Contadina. Hotel will give directions 2 blocks away. The absolute best Italian in the city. Reservations are a good idea. Roasted pepper appetizer is a must!
Reviews.Author: abbeykat13

Reviews.Content: I am in Love with Hotel Boheme! This Hotel is next to all the best Restaurants in the city, right next to Washington square park, steps from Chinatown and Union Square, Fisherman's wharf right down the street as well. This is seriously the best place to stay in San Francisco it's so charming and the rooms are nicely decorated and romantic.There are lots of coffee shops like Cafe Trieste right up the block also Beach Blanket Babylon is right up the street and Jazz at Pearls which I both recommend. Mama's right by Washington square is great for Breakfast also if it's a nice day you can take a picnic in the park.There is a cafe right downstairs called Calzone's which is open until 2 a.m. it is a nice spot to get a night cap before heading up to rest.We walked around Union square the first day we got there and we were not impressed with all the hotels in that area..no charm to them like this one.Will definetly return my boyfriend really loved this place! So did I!
Reviews.Author: LinaLina

Reviews.Content: Wonderful, Clean, Good Location We stayed at the Hotel Boheme in North Beach in September. It was a wonderful hotel - the room and bathroom was very clean and the decor was really cozy. We stayed on the street and liked hearing the noise from the street below. It was nice to sit and look out the window while waiting to go out. We slept with the windows open and was woken up in the middle of the night once to the street sweeper. There are many restaurants right outside the hotel. The hotel is in a good location. Down the street is a restaurant called Volare that I would highly recommend and still get a taste for. I ordered their Gnocchi al Pesto both times we ate there. Heading from Volare to the hotel, there is a a gelato place on a corner - I forgot the name - but it exclusively sells gelato - it is THE CLOSEST to real Italian gelato that I have had in America. very good dessert. While in San Francisco, we rented bicycles and rode across the Goldent Gate bridge (bicycles rented from the pier). This was such a good time and a unique way to view the bridge. Another must for San Francisco is the Alcatraz tour. The self guided audio is very interesting. The staff/guides at the prison also told stories and gave demonstrations - including locking volunteers (us included) in the hole (solitary confinement). what an experience!
Reviews.Author: TravelingPantalones

Reviews.Content: Charming and friendly Just returned from a weekend in San Francisco - stayed at Hotel Boheme in North Beach. A small boutique hotel in a great location in Little Italy. Our room looked out onto the main strip lined with wonderful bakeries and restaurants. The room was darling and brightly painted and the bathroom was clean with wonderful tile and antique fixtures. The room had a bistro table with 2 chairs in front of the window and an elegant armoire. The innkeeper was friendly and informative and made everyone feel welcome and at home - serving evening cordials in the reception area. Definately would stay again!
Reviews.Author: troocha

Reviews.Content: Just like Italy My husband and I spent three nights at Hotel Boheme in San Francisco from August 11-14. We arrived around 10:00pm Friday night and actually missed the entrance and had to have our cab driver go around the block. Upon our arrival and greeting, we knew we selected a great place. Stan, who was working that weekend, gave us the lowdown on the best restaurants and neighborhoods, and the best time to get in line at Mama's for breakfast (before 8am). He really made our stay memorable. We asked for an interior room because we read previous reviews saying the noise from Columbus Street below could be bothersome. We never heard a thing. Our room was comfortable and clean, with a beautiful bed and decent size bathroom. The room, and entire hotel for that matter, really reminded us of the pensiones we stayed in when we visited Italy last year. Hotel Boheme is small, intimate, romantic, and worth the stay. Another plus is the hotel location. Columbus Street is the heart of Washington Square and Little Italy, and is only a few blocks from Chinatown and a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of great bars, restaurants, and a fantastic gelateria nearby - closest thing to real Italian gelato we've found. We would definitely stay at Hotel Boheme again.
Reviews.Author: kkic04

Reviews.Content: This is where the action is! My fiancee and I LOVED this hotel. Check-in was a bit worrisome, due to the fact that we are not used to driving in a big city and we had to stop in the middle of the street to unload luggage. There is complimentary sherry in the evenings and the neighberhood is very good for the middle of a major city. The rooms are too, too charming (in a good way!) and you can't ask for a better location. There are six very tasty eateries within 50 yards of the front entrance. Fabulous pastries, Italian food, and Chinese food as well. Chinatown is within walking distance (next door in fact). The next time we visit San Francisco, we will be staying at this hotel without a second thought.
Reviews.Author: willahlborn

Reviews.Content: Boutique style hotel in fabulous location This is a great hotel if you want to experience San Francisco in the non-touristy way. It's located in North Beach and a lot of the regular tourist sites are within walking distance. Have a cup of coffee at Cafe Trieste around the corner, grab a morning snack at the Stella's Pastry, take in the great show of Beach Blanket Babylon at the Fugazi, hang out in Washington Square park. There are also a ton of great restaurants to choose from. Downtown is probably about 6-7 blocks away, or you can walk over to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel rooms are small, but they feel very home-y. The decor is kind of artsy. Bathrooms are a little small too and they don't have a separate toilet room from the shower. The front desk staff are incredibly nice and accomodating. I don't think I've ever experienced any hotel staff who seemed as truly genuine as they were. At night, a carafe of sherry is put out for guests to sample. It was great to come back from a night out, and then be treated to an after-dinner drink. This is a hotel for people who want to get away from it all (TV was about a 14 inch) and feel like they are staying with their friends in the city. It's not a resort, but it's a great place to stay.
Reviews.Author: TessSB

Reviews.Content: In the Heart of North Beach. Italian or Chinese My wife and I love this place. It is in the heart of San Francisco鈥檚 North Beach District, just a block north of the famous 鈥淐ity Lights鈥?book store. The hotel is surrounded by some of the best Italian restaurants in the city. It鈥檚 a near perfect San Francisco experience. Hotel Boheme itself is located on Columbus Street in the heart of an old Italian neighborhood. The only sign of a hotel at 444 Columbus is a single innocuous doorway covered by a small awning. That doorway is wedged between the sidewalk caf茅 鈥淐alazones鈥?and a small Italian bakery. You have to buzz at the door to enter but you get a key for this door on check in. Past the door is a steep and narrow staircase leading up to the next floor. On the second floor to the right of the landing is the hotel office. A bottle of Sherry surrounded by cordial glasses is set out for guests on the landing sideboard each night. Hotel staff are always friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about everything San Francisco. They have always made our visits to stays in the city easy and fun.Our last trip to San Francisco, June of 2006 became our fourth time staying at the Hotel Boheme. The rooms are small and simple but quite elegant. Our room had a queen bed, armoire and a bistro table with two chairs. Our bathroom was tiled and had a glass front shower. Everything was spotless. The hotel motif is straight from the beat generation with names like Laurence Ferlengetti, Jack Keroac, Ken Kesey and Jake Cassidy dominating the hotel art and some of the furniture as well.Two comments for your consideration is the difficulty with parking. Parking is a problem all over San Francisco. The closest Public Parking to Hotel Boheme is on Valejo street about a block and a half way. Be prepared to pay $26 dollars per day for public parking. Secondly, if you are a light sleeper or are unused to the sounds of the city then request and 鈥渋nside鈥?room. Any room that fronts onto Columbus Street can be noisy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Staff       Hotel Along Columbus Ave
Reviews.Author: Willow101

Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better
Reviews.Author: bartr

Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel with character Hotel Boheme is a nicely restored building on Columbus Avenue -- the main street of the North Beach (Italian) section of San Francisco. It's a great area for urban hikers, especially if they don't mind some steep grades -- Russian Hill, the Coit Tower, and Chinatown are all fairly close, and may other parts of San Francisco are a long walk (or a cab ride) away.Entrance to the hotel is tucked between patio tables of restaurants below, and you climb a flight of stairs to the concierge desk. Then, if necessary, another flight to your room.Stan was our concierge, and he began making suggestions about where to visit before we even asked. Charles was equally solicitous on our way out. These guys really want you to enjoy your stay, and really know both the neighborhood and the city.Rooms are small, cozy, and retro, with decor celebrating the Beat era of North Beach, and rooms painted deep colors. Our room was in very good shape save one patch of damaged ceiling.Hotel Boheme does not try to be a full-service hotel. Room service consists of a limited menu of beverages only. Our room had a very small TV set (which we didn't need anyway). No fitness center or expansive lobby.Complimentary sherry is provided from the concierge area in the evenings.Here's the main thing: if you take a room fronting along Columbus Ave., you can sit near the window and watch the sidewalks below, which is fun. You also get a lot of street noise (Saturday night brought a lot of late-night revelry to the sidewalk cafes below; Sunday wasn't as bad). So either take the street-side room and be prepared (bring ear plugs for sleeping?) or else ask for a quieter room, or stay elsewhere.We'll be back to Hotel Boheme -- with earplugs.During our stay, we enjoyed a martini at the Beat-culture-soaked Vesuvio bar (next door to the famous City Lights bookstore), a focaccia sandwich and capuccino at Mario's Bohemian Cigar Shop  Restaurant, a decent dinner at Calzone's under the hotel, and a very nice dinner at Steps of Rome Trattoria. Nearby O'Reilly's Irish pub puts out a hearty brunch. Its hard to starve or get thirsty in this neighborhood. Don't worry, the hotel staff can point you to all these places  more; we also found the Lonely Planet San Francisco guide useful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I recommend it!
Reviews.Author: joe_bleaux

Reviews.Content: I agree - its Fab! This is the place for me! Personality, service, great location - the neighborhood is my favorite in SF. Service was REALLY GOOD, they are nice people that make you feel at home. Tasteful  unique decor - and the bakery downstairs makes the best cappucino ever. I will definately stay there any time I am in San Francisco. Don't miss North Beach Pizza nearby. I really don't want to share this hotel - but can't keep it to myself! The only downside is the stairs but the staff will help you in any way they can with that. Besides - its SF - get used to climbing!
Reviews.Author: swami12

Reviews.Content: Funky Little Hotel This was my second stay this hotel The staff was extremely nice and the sherry evening reception was a nice end to a long day. The rooms are very small but the bathrooms are surprisingly large in comparision. I had a great time looking at all the photos in the halls. The hotel needs a bit of work, a bit more than the first time I stayed (oct 01). Be warned, there is NO elevator and the check in desk is up three flights of stairs and my room was another two flights up. It was my fault that I packed too heavy! Apparently this hasn't deterred me from coming back. It's not the Ritz by any means, but it's safe and it's a clean place to stay. Who stays at the hotel all day in SF anyway??
Reviews.Author: Gigi318

Reviews.Content: Okay, but wouldn't unreservedly recommend.... Great location in North beach, handy to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown too. Staff very friendly and helpful and manage to provide useful, suggestive advice without being too pushy or intrusive.Rooms however are VERY small and quite dark. No clothes iron or in-room safe. Small 14 inch television (mine broke down). In general more like an Inn than a Hotel, and although my stay was pleasant enough, $159 plus tax did seem like a bit much to pay for what it was.
Reviews.Author: gasman

Reviews.Content: A gem! An absolute gem. I really can鈥檛 recommend this hotel enough. It鈥檚 above a bakery on a busy street in North Beach (the bustling Italian district with lots of great cafes and restaurants). Fisherman鈥檚 Wharf and all the other main sights are within a 20 minute walk (downhill!) and Chinatown is five minutes away.The hotel itself is an oasis of calm in a mad city. The rooms are all individually styled and complementary sherry is served in the lobby in the evenings. There is no breakfast, but the bakery downstairs is great for coffee and pastries.The best thing about this hotel is the staff. The guys on the front desk were the most knowledgeable and friendly staff I have ever come across and I鈥檓 fairly well travelled. Ask them any question about the city and they can recommend something. They know all the best local restaurants other than the tourist traps and always got us tables. They also know what bars to visit, little markets you wouldn鈥檛 otherwise find etc. Stay here: you won鈥檛 be disappointed!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff.   showReview(3460905, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A diamond in a beautiful city   showReview(2985551, 'full');

Reviews.Content: My favorite too.   showReview(2793131, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Fabulous!   showReview(2718138, 'full');

Reviews.Content: so-so   showReview(2129947, 'full');

Reviews.Content: An Epic Weekend   showReview(354840, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Niente di che   showReview(18277059, 'full');
Reviews.Author: teiadot

Reviews.Content: Tolles Hotel, wundersch枚ne Gegend   showReview(15726048, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Reisende7278

Reviews.Content: Tr猫s bien plac茅 et tout mignon       la vue de la chambre
Reviews.Author: Denaris
